name: Benzene

energies.comment: Total bond energy from experimental data (kJ/mol). Benzene has aromatic stabilization making bonds STRONGER than localized structure. Naive (3 single + 3 double + 6 CH) = 5322 kJ/mol. Actual is ~150 kJ/mol higher due to resonance strengthening all C-C bonds.

reference_energies.comment: Standard bond energies (kJ/mol) for naive calculation

notes: Benzene exhibits aromatic stabilization (~150 kJ/mol resonance energy)
Bond orders shown as 1.5 to represent delocalized Ï€-system
Naive prediction would use localized single/double bonds
This is THE canonical example of additivity violation in chemistry
